intro: Alsine gieseckii, commonly known as the desert sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments. Its life cycle is often annual, with rapid growth and reproduction to complete its development before the onset of drought. Alsine gieseckii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
